intro: Curculigo veratrifolia, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role.
